name: Apple Cedar Apple Rust
description: Apple Cedar Apple Rust is a fungal disease that affects apple trees, caused by the pathogen Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae. It typically appears as orange or rust-colored spots on the leaves, fruit, and twigs of apple trees.
symptoms: Orange or rust-colored spots on leaves, fruit, and twigs
Yellowing and premature dropping of leaves
treatment: Treatment involves pruning infected branches, applying fungicides, and removing nearby juniper plants which serve as alternate hosts for the pathogen.

name: Apple Black Rot
description: Apple Black Rot is a fungal disease caused by the pathogen Botryosphaeria obtusa. It affects apple trees and causes dark, sunken lesions on fruit, leaves, and twigs.
symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on fruit, leaves, and twigs
treatment: Treatment involves removing infected plant parts, applying fungicides, and practicing good orchard sanitation to reduce disease spread.

name: Apple Scab
description: Apple Scab is a fungal disease caused by the pathogen Venturia inaequalis. It affects apple trees and appears as olive-green to black lesions on leaves, fruit, and twigs.
symptoms: Olive-green to black lesions on leaves, fruit, and twigs
treatment: Treatment involves pruning infected branches, applying fungicides, and practicing good orchard hygiene to minimize disease spread.
